articles.title: Perspective | David Stern built the NBA into a colossus, but he was an even better man - The Washington Post
articles.description: Perspective | David Stern built the NBA into a colossus, but he was an even better man The Washington Post David Stern always had the NBA's best interests at heart – Stephen A. Smith | SC with SVP ESPN Barker: Stern was the most important commissioner ever Ne…
articles.content:
Halberstam made that comment in 1980, shortly after writing his brilliant book, The Breaks of the Game, and a few months after Magic Johnsons remarkable 42-point performance in Game 6 of the NBA Finals had been televised on tape delay by CBS.
Yes, tape delay… [+7302 chars]
